verses.text: Afterward he brought me to the temple, and measured the posts, six cubits broad on the one side, and six cubits broad on the other side, \add which was\add* the breadth of the tabernacle.

And the breadth of the door \add was\add* ten cubits; and the sides of the door \add were\add* five cubits on the one side, and five cubits on the other side: and he measured the length thereof, forty cubits: and the breadth, twenty cubits.
Then went he inward, and measured the post of the door, two cubits; and the door, six cubits; and the breadth of the door, seven cubits.
So he measured the length thereof, twenty cubits; and the breadth, twenty cubits, before the temple: and he said unto me, This \add is\add* the most holy \add place\add*.
After he measured the wall of the house, six cubits; and the breadth of \add every\add* side chamber, four cubits, round about the house on every side.

And the side chambers \add were\add* three, one over another, and thirty \add in\add* order; and they entered into the wall which \add was\add* of the house for the side chambers round about, that \add they\add* might have hold, but they had not hold in the wall of the house.

And \add there was\add* an enlarging, and a winding about still upward to the side chambers: for the winding about of the house \add went\add* still upward round about the house: therefore the breadth of the house \add was still\add* upward, and so increased \add from\add* the lowest \add chamber\add* to the highest by the midst.
I saw also the height of the house round about: the foundations of the side chambers \add were\add* a full reed of six great cubits.

The thickness of the wall, which \add was\add* for the side chamber without, \add was\add* five cubits: and \add that\add* which \add was\add* left \add was\add* the place of the side chambers that \add were\add* within.
And between the chambers \add was\add* the wideness of twenty cubits round about the house on every side.

And the doors of the side chambers \add were\add* toward \add the place\add* that \add was\add* left, one door toward the north, and another door toward the south: and the breadth of the place that was left \add was\add* five cubits round about.

Now the building that \add was\add* before the separate place \add at\add* the end toward the west \add was\add* seventy cubits broad; and the wall of the building \add was\add* five cubits thick round about, and the length thereof ninety cubits.
So he measured the house, an hundred cubits long; and the separate place, and the building, with the walls thereof, an hundred cubits long;
also the breadth of the face of the house, and of the separate place toward the east, an hundred cubits.

And he measured the length of the building over against the separate place which \add was\add* behind it, and the galleries thereof on the one side and on the other side, an hundred cubits, with the inner temple, and the porches of the court;

the door posts, and the narrow windows, and the galleries round about on their three \add stories\add*, over against the door, cieled with wood round about, and \add from\add* the ground up to the windows, and the windows \add were\add* covered;
to \add that\add* above the door, even unto the inner house, and without, and by all the wall round about within and without, \add by\add* measure.
And \add it was\add* made \add with\add* cherubims and palm trees, so that a palm tree \add was\add* between a cherub and a cherub; and \add every\add* cherub had two faces;

so that the face of a man \add was\add* toward the palm tree on the one side, and the face of a young lion toward the palm tree on the other side: \add it was\add* made through all the house round about.
From the ground unto above the door \add were\add* cherubims and palm trees made, and \add on\add* the wall of the temple.
The posts of the temple \add were\add* squared, \add and\add* the face of the sanctuary; the appearance \add of the one\add* as the appearance \add of the other\add*.

The altar \add of\add* wood \add was\add* three cubits high, and the length thereof two cubits; and the corners thereof, and the length thereof, and the walls thereof, \add were of\add* wood: and he said unto me, This \add is\add* the table that \add is\add* before the \sc Lord\sc*.
And the temple and the sanctuary had two doors.
And the doors had two leaves \add apiece\add*, two turning leaves; two \add leaves\add* for the one door, and two leaves for the other \add door\add*.

And \add there were\add* made on them, on the doors of the temple, cherubims and palm trees, like as \add were\add* made upon the walls; and \add there were\add* thick planks upon the face of the porch without.
And \add there were\add* narrow windows and palm trees on the one side and on the other side, on the sides of the porch, and \add upon\add* the side chambers of the house, and thick planks.
